item.title: Trump Threatens 25% Tariffs on Apple If iPhones Not Made in US
item.description: President Donald Trump threatened Apple Inc. with a tariff of at least 25% if it does not manufacture its iPhones in the US, ramping up pressure on the tech giant to secure more domestic production.
item.dc:creator: Skylar Woodhouse, Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: An advertisement for an Apple iPhone. Photographer: Jason Alden/Bloomberg

item.title: Vietnam Takes Steps to Block Telegram Over Illegal Content
item.description: Vietnam authorities have instructed local telecoms and internet service providers to block the Telegram messaging app in the country, for allegedly failing to prevent illegal content and anti-government activities being carried out by its users.
item.dc:creator: Francesca Stevens

media:content.media:description: The logo for Telegram application arranged on a smartphone in Hong Kong, China, on Wednesday, March 6, 2024. The Hong Kong government’s document summarizing recent public consultations on proposed domestic security legislation included suggestions that some popular messaging apps be prohibited, though authorities stopped short of endorsing that view. Photographer: Lam Yik/Bloomberg

item.title: CoreWeave Bulls Face Off Against Short Sellers as Shares Spike
item.description: CoreWeave Inc. shares have been on a tear as investors snap up the stock despite widespread concerns about elevated debt levels, the rate of cash-burn and the long-term demand for the cloud-computing services it provides.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke, Jeran Wittenstein

media:content.media:description: CoreWeave signage in Times Square in New York.

item.title: Surge of Successful Tech IPOs Gives Hope to Silicon Valley Startups
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Katie Roof and Kate Clark report on the light at the end of the tunnel for Silicon Valley tech startups after a few recent successful debuts in the public markets.
item.dc:creator: Katie Roof, Kate Clark

media:content.media:description: Hinge Health Inc. signage on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange Thursday during the company's initial public offering.

item.title: Tiger-Backed Robinhood Rival Launches DIY Indexing With a Twist
item.description: What if you wanted to build an index betting on companies traveling to Mars, firms with the most social-media followers, or those with CEOs over six feet tall?
item.dc:creator: Claire Ballentine, Vildana Hajric

media:content.media:description: Jannick Malling

item.title: South Africa Pushes Policy Directive to Smooth Way for Starlink
item.description: South Africa’s government plans to push ahead with a policy directive that provides a workaround to Black-ownership requirements in the telecommunications industry, aiming to encourage Elon Musk’s Starlink and other satellite services to operate in the country.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo, S'thembile Cele

media:content.media:description: A Falcon 9 rocket with multiple Starlink satellites.

item.title: A $20,000 ‘Home Companion’ Robot From China to Debut This Year
item.description: China’s UBTech Robotics Corp. is planning to unveil a $20,000 humanoid robot that can serve as a household companion this year, seeking to expand beyond factories.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: A humanoid robot from UBTECH at the Beijng World of Robots in Beijing.

item.title: UAE’s AI University Aims to Become Stanford of the Gulf
item.description: Mohamed bin Zayed University of AI is focused on building an engineering pipeline, incubating homegrown startups, and hypercharging the region’s AI development
item.dc:creator: Omar El Chmouri, Mark Bergen

media:content.media:description: The Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence in Abu Dhabi’s Masdar City.

item.title: OnlyFans Owner Exploring Sale at $8 Billion Valuation
item.description: OnlyFans Ltd. owner Leonid Radvinsky is exploring a sale of the adult-content social network that would value it at about $8 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Berthelot

media:content.media:description: A neon OnlyFans Ltd. sign in the window of the company's offices in London, UK, on Friday, Oct. 4, 2022. OnlyFans executives have mapped out a plan to become more transparent and highlight less-explicit content at a time when the company’s home country is finalizing strict new online safety laws.

item.title: EngineAI Targets $1 Billion Valuation as Chinese Robots Heat Up
item.description: EngineAI is targeting a round of financing later this year at a $1 billion valuation, seeking capital to join a global race to develop humanoid robots.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding, Annabelle Droulers

media:content.media:description: Ren Guowen Source: Bloomberg

item.title: China Asks Dutch to Ease Chips Export Curbs, Minister Says
item.description: China has asked the Netherlands to relax export restrictions related to semiconductors, Dutch Foreign Affairs Minister Caspar Veldkamp said following a meeting with officials in Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Van Oosterom

media:content.media:description: Employees assemble an ASML lithography machine in Veldhoven, Netherlands.

item.title: AI 'Washers' Can't Exaggerate Their Way Out of This One
item.description: The collapse of a high-flying startup may mark a broader decline in the practice of secretly using humans behind a curtain.
item.dc:creator: Parmy Olson

media:content.media:description: Deflated.

item.title: BYD Dealerships Failing Show Financial Pain in China Car Sector
item.description: Car dealership groups in two provinces have gone out of business since last month in China, both of them BYD Co. retailers, evidence of the tough competition in the nation’s auto market and proof that not even selling the country’s No. 1 brand can shield businesses from financial difficulties.
item.dc:creator: Linda Lew

media:content.media:description: A BYD Co. dealership in Beijing. Photographer: Na Bian/Bloomberg

item.title: China’s Meituan, Xiaomi See Long-Term Expansion Efforts in Spotlight
item.description: Meituan and Xiaomi Corp.’s long-term ambitions and investment plans will dominate next week’s earnings releases, continuing to shape sentiment for China’s tech sector.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Yeo, Reina Sasaki, Justina T Lee, Harshita Swaminathan

item.title: OnlyFans in Talks for Sale at $8 Billion Valuation, Reuters Says
item.description: A Los Angeles investment firm is in discussions to buy out OnlyFans Ltd. in a deal that values the site at $8 billion, Reuters reported.
item.dc:creator: Edwin Chan

media:content.media:description: This photograph taken in Nantes, western France on May 21, 2025, shows the logo of British social network OnlyFans, OF. OnlyFans, which is based in London and which was created in 2016, hosts erotic content, even pornographic, as well as fitness content, musicians and other creators who post regularly online. (Photo by Loic VENANCE / AFP) (Photo by LOIC VENANCE/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Live Action ‘Elden Ring’ Film in Works, Directed by Alex Garland
item.description: A24 Films and Bandai Namco Entertainment Inc. will work with Ex Machina director Alex Garland on a live-action film based on the fantasy role-playing game Elden Ring.
item.dc:creator: Mayumi Negishi

media:content.media:description: Alex Garland Photographer: Emma McIntyre/SiriusXM

item.title: YouTube Poaches Disney Official, Triggering Lawsuit Against Video Service
item.description: Disney responds with a complaint in California court claiming breach of contract
item.dc:creator: Lucas Shaw

media:content.media:description: BEVERLY HILLS, CALIFORNIA - MAY 06: Justin Connolly, President of Platform Distribution for The Walt Disney Company, speaks onstage during The WICT Network Signature Awards Luncheon at Beverly Wilshire, A Four Seasons Hotel on May 06, 2025 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Anna Webber/Getty Images for The Wict Network)

item.title: Workday Gives Lackluster Growth Outlook Despite New AI Tools
item.description: Workday Inc. projected subscription revenue in the current quarter in line with Wall Street estimates, disappointing investors looking for the software company to get a boost from new artificial intelligence features for its products.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

item.title: OpenAI's UAE Data Center, AT&T-Lumen Consumer Fiber Deal | Bloomberg Technology
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow talk to OpenAI’s Global Policy President Chris Lehane about the company’s plans to build more international data centers. Plus, Kraken Co-CEO Arjun Sethi discusses why the crypto exchange has partnered with Backed to let customers outside the US trade Apple, Nvidia, and Tesla shares around the clock. And AT&T CEO John Stankey explains why the telecom giant is buying Lumen’s consumer fiber operations. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Ryan Reynolds’ MNTN Shares Rise 65% After $187 Million IPO
item.description: Connected TV advertising platform MNTN Inc.’s shares climbed 65% after the company and some of its shareholders raised $187 million in an initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Ryan Reynolds

item.title: Intuit Posts Strong Growth After Launching More Tax Services
item.description: Intuit Inc. posted strong revenue growth following the end of the US tax season, suggesting the financial software company is finding success offering users more expensive services.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Intuit Turbotax

item.title: Anthropic CEO Braces His Employees for AI to Change How They Work
item.description: One of the leading artificial intelligence research labs is rethinking the way its employees work because of AI. But first...
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Dario Amodei, chief executive officer of Anthropic, has told employees the company may slow down hiring because of AI.

item.title: Apple Plans Glasses for 2026 as Part of AI Push, Nixes Watch With Camera
item.description: Apple Inc. is aiming to release smart glasses at the end of next year as part of a push into AI-enhanced gadgets, but it has shelved plans for a smartwatch that can analyze its surroundings with a built-in camera.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Meta’s Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses have emerged as a popular early example of an AI device.

item.title: Pershing Square Buys Amazon Stake After 31% Drop in Stock Price
item.description: Bill Ackman’s Pershing Square Capital Management built a new stake in Amazon.com Inc., calling it a “fantastic franchise” and noting that the investor acquired shares at an “extremely attractive” price.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Soper

media:content.media:description: Packages on a conveyor belt are automatically sorted for shipping at an Amazon Fulfillment center on Cyber Monday in Robbinsville, New Jersey, US, on Monday, Dec. 2, 2024. Over the past weekend, US buyers spent a record $10.9 billion online, according to data from Adobe, and the company expects consumers to splurge another $13.2 billion on Cyber Monday.

item.title: Blue Owl-Tied Data Center Gets $7.1 Billion in Financing
item.description: A consortium led by JPMorgan Chase & Co. is providing a $7.1 billion construction loan for a massive AI data center project in Abilene, Texas.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Wong

media:content.media:description: JPMorgan Chase & Co Photographer: Scott Eells/Bloomberg

item.title: Tinder CEO Steps Down in Latest Shakeup at Match Group
item.description: Tinder Chief Executive Officer Faye Iosotaluno will step down in July after less than two years in the role, adding to a string of executive changes at parent company Match Group Inc., which has struggled to return Tinder, its largest dating app brand, to growth.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Faye Iosotaluno Photographer: Chesnot/Getty Images

item.title: OpenAI Eyes Stargate Data Centers for AI in Asia-Pacific
item.description: OpenAI is eyeing the Asia-Pacific for future data center sites, joining an already heated race to build out AI infrastructure in the region.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: The OpenAI logo on a laptop computer arranged in the Brooklyn borough of New York, US, on Thursday, Jan. 12, 2023. Microsoft Corp. is in discussions to invest as much as $10 billion in OpenAI, the creator of viral artificial intelligence bot ChatGPT, according to people familiar with its plans. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: OpenAI Announces Stargate Data Center Expansion in Abu Dhabi
item.description: OpenAI is helping to develop a major data center in the United Arab Emirates, a big overseas expansion of its Stargate effort to build out AI infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary, Mackenzie Hawkins

media:content.media:description: The Stargate construction site in Abilene.

item.title: AI Startup Anthropic Releases More Powerful Opus Model After Delay
item.description: Anthropic is set to roll out two new versions of its Claude artificial intelligence software, including a long-delayed update to its high-end Opus model, as the startup vies to stay ahead of a crowded market.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Metz

media:content.media:description: Anthropic is rolling out two new versions of its Claude artificial intelligence software.

item.title: Startup Builder.ai Overestimated Sales by 300% to Creditors
item.description: When Builder.ai was seeking an emergency loan last year, the startup gave lenders a revenue forecast that proved to be four times its actual sales, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Yazhou Sun

media:content.media:description: Sachin Duggal
